item.title: R-Type Delta: HD Boosted launches November 20 in Japan
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Available in three physical editions.

R-Type Delta: HD Boosted will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam on November 20 in Japan, publisher City Connection announced.

The game will be available in the following editions:

  • Digital Edition (all platforms)
    • Standard Edition (4,950 yen)
      • A copy of the game
  • Physical Editions (PlayStation 5, Switch)
    • Standard Edition (4,950 yen)
      • A copy of the game
    • R-Typer’s Edition (12,650 yen)
      • A copy of the game
      • Two-disc soundtrack CD
      • Official fan book
      • B3-size cloth poster
    • R-Typer’s Premium Edition (19,800 yen)
      • A copy of the game
      • Two-disc soundtrack CD
      • Official fan book
      • B3-size cloth poster
      • Metallic art mini poster set (x9)
      • Main visual lenticular
      • Irem newsletter “Dragonfly” R-Type special issue reprint

Here is an overview of the game, via City Connection:

About

Your nightmares, now in high-definition! R-Type Delta: HD Boosted brings back the dark, iconic shooter with modern enhancements, new music, razor-sharp graphics, and all the intensity you remember.

A Timeless Classic Returns

R-Type Delta is one of the finest shoot ‘em ups ever and took the gaming world by storm upon its release in 1998. Now, 27 years later, history repeats itself with R-Type Delta: HD Boosted. With its tight level design, three selectable ships, powerful Delta Attacks, and the brilliant Force mechanic, this new edition proves that gaming classics of this caliber are truly timeless. If you played R-Type Delta back in the day, this is the perfect opportunity to return to its dark science fiction action. If you’ve never experienced this essential piece of gaming history before, now is the time.

Sharper Than Ever

R-Type Delta: HD Boosted features high-resolution graphics that hone the polygonal edges of this PlayStation masterpiece until they’re sharp enough to cut glass. You simply haven’t experienced R-Type Delta until you’ve played it in high definition! Of course, the game also comes equipped with modern quality-of-life improvements.

Environmental Storytelling

What has always made R-Type Delta so fantastic is its dark, eerie atmosphere. Shoot-’em-ups are not typically known for storytelling, but R-Type Delta: HD Boosted excels with its simple, minimalist environmental storytelling, characteristic of the late ’90s. It’s a narrative that is as fascinating as it is unsettling, as adrenaline-pumping as it is deeply disturbing. And all this without a single word being spoken.

The Meaning of Delta

The name “Delta” carries several meanings. Firstly, the Greek letter delta resembles a triangle, which coincidentally has as many sides as there are playable ships in the game. It is also the fourth letter of the Greek alphabet, and R-Type Delta is the fourth game in the R-Type series. Additionally, the delta triangle is the simplest type of polygon, which is fitting since R-Type Delta was the first game in the series to use three-dimensional polygon graphics instead of two-dimensional sprites.

Story

The year is 2163, and the badly damaged R9 Arrowhead fighter has just returned to Earth after its mission to destroy the Bydo Empire. The vessel is rescued by the battle-cruiser Croque-Monsieur and transported to an orbital space station. One year later, astronomers in Central Asia observe mysterious objects falling from the sky, and moments later, control is lost over the orbiting annihilation platform Moritz-G. This high-tech machine, capable of destroying the entire planet, descends over a city and levels it to the ground. Although its planet-destroying weapons have not yet been activated, its advanced defense systems make Moritz-G virtually impossible to approach. A desperate military operation is launched, and the prototype ship R9aII Delta is deployed to resolve the situation. Thus begins the epic battle that is R-Type Delta!

item.title: Bishojo card battle RPG Destiny Code announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

"A dramatic chronicle where strategy and decisions shape fate."

Publisher aNCHOR and developer Project L.A. have announced Destiny Code, a “card battle RPG woven with bishojo.” It will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam and Epic Games Store in 2025 with language support for English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese.

The Early Access release will feature seven playable characters, each with their own background and combat style, as well as the core turn-based, card-driven interactive battle system gameplay. The main story spans up to Chapter 2, including individual character events and sub-events. Future updates will introduce new encounters, new stories, and unseen fragments of the world. It is expected to remain in Early Access for about one year.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

A card battle RPG woven with bishojo! In a clash over the relics of a lost civilization, what choices will they make? A dramatic chronicle where strategy and decisions shape fate.

Bishojo x Card Battle RPG

A school life spent with cute and beautiful girls!

As an agent of the “Ancient Prehistoric Civilization Central Intelligence Executive Agency,” Hart Grancer is a former boy mercenary who has infiltrated the “Academy,” a.k.a. the teaching institution of the subordinate organization.

He is assigned to teach a group of girls who have some mysterious reason to be there, as well as to take on assignments from the Administration.

Then one day, a new mission comes along—the discovery and recovery of the “Grimforge.” But that was also the beginning of a huge conspiracy.

Friends Fighting Together

  • Akina Akitsuki
    • Birthday: October 12
    • Height: 156 cm
    • Weapon: Darts and Thrusting Sword
    • Hometown: 7th Precinct, Moomoo
    • Description: A very ordinary girl who is bright and likes pretty things. She is a hard worker, but sometimes feels inferior to the talented people around her. While everything is normal, she only has big boobs.
  • Elise von Richthofen
    • Birthday: August 15
    • Height: 156cm
    • Weapon: Gun / Sword
    • Hometown: Imperial City of Invoa
    • Description: She is the third daughter of a former noble family and is very proud. Contrary to her haughty attitude, she is weak and easily puts on airs when she is coaxed. She likes glittering and flashy things. She speaks the family motto without being asked to do so.
  • Linghua Lang
    • Birthday: February 4
    • Height: 141cm
    • Weapon: Yoyo
    • Hometown: Tajine, 212th precinct
  • Alesha Hammond
    • Birthday: March 3
    • Height: 151cm
    • Weapon: None
    • Hometown: 351st Precinct, Caldoverde
    • Description: She is a quiet girl who seems to be in the corner reading a book. She is shy and is not good at communicating or being in a crowd. She hides behind her clothes, but she actually has big tits.
  • Selene Grancer
    • Birthday: May 3
    • Height: 141cm
    • Weapon: Railgun Blade
    • Birthplace: Unknown
    • Description: She is a pouty girl who is hard to see her emotions, but inside she is surprisingly passionate and sweet-natured. She easily misses animals, and Selene loves them too. She is small in stature but has a toned body.
  • Saki Aihara
    • Birthday: January 18
    • Height: 158cm
    • Weapon: Stun Rods and Large Pistols
    • Hometown: 81st precinct, Yamato
    • Description: Very serious committee chairperson type. She is so versatile that girls would adore her, and she has breasts and a great style. Don’t tell everyone, but she actually secretly writes light novels (love stories).

Main Story

The “fragments” scattered throughout the world are silent witnesses to the pain of a forgotten age. Whenever the girls reach for them, they find themselves suspended between what was and what’s to come. Within the pulse of life, feelings take root—and choices must be made. A single story begins, shaped by prayers and sins alike.

As an agent of the “Ancient Prehistoric Civilization Central Intelligence Executive Agency,” Hart Grancer is a former boy mercenary who has infiltrated the “Academy,” a.k.a. the teaching institution of the subordinate organization. He is assigned to teach a group of girls who have some mysterious reason to be there, as well as to take on assignments from the Administration.

Then one day, a new mission comes along—the discovery and recovery of the “Grimforge.” But that was also the beginning of a huge conspiracy.

Key Features

  • Premium Events – In the midst of the bustling days, a quiet pause gently appears. There, you’ll see a gesture they usually hide, or a smile that escapes before they notice. Moments that quietly bring you closer to the girls—a fleeting promise of a future not yet named.
  • Card Battles – Use the cards that reflect the personalities and skills of your friends to win the battle!
  • Battle Features – New cards are added to your hand by your actions in battle. Do you take the best action now? Or prepare for the next battle? Watch for opportunities and build your deck during battle!
  • Make a Character “Yours” – “Artifacts” can be equipped to compensate for weaknesses or develop more individuality. Strengthen your favorite character as much as possible! In addition, artifacts can be synthesized! You can create new artifacts that inherit your desired abilities!

Creator Profile: Developer’s Comment

“I found myself getting together. We found ourselves making it. Battles, drama, friendship, and a little bit of crying—. We packed it all into this work.”

item.title: Sumikko Gurashi Tsukurou! Suteki-na Sumikko Shima announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out this winter in Japan.

Nippon Columbia has announced “Sumikko communication” game Sumikko Gurashi Tsukurou! Suteki-na Sumikko Shima for Switch. It will launch this winter in Japan for 5,800 yen (6,380 yen with tax).

Here is an overview of the game, via Nippon Columbia:

Build a Marvelous Island With the Sumikko

Work with the Sumikko on an uninhabited island to build a cozy island. While fulfilling the Sumikko’s requests, you’ll gather materials to create buildings and decorations, grow and harvest fruits and vegetables, and enjoy building a marvelous island all your own alongside the Sumikko.

Build a Cozy Island Suited to the Seasons

The island experiences all four seasons, with its scenery and available materials changing according to the season. Since the Sumikko care deeply about the changing seasons, aim to create a cozy island that makes them happy by placing seasonal buildings and decorations around the island.

Watch the Sumikko’s Island Life and Relax

The Sumikko will play on swings, enjoy flower-viewing while eating dumplings, and show off various adorable behaviors depending on the items you place around the island. You can take photos of the Sumikko and save them to your album to revisit at any time.

A Wealth of Objects and Costumes

There is a wide variety of cute, placeable items, such as buildings and decorations, available in the game. Each character also has numerous costumes, so you can dress up the Sumikko however you like and enjoy seeing them in a variety of adorable looks.

View the first screenshots at the gallery. Visit the official website here.

item.title: Drag x Drive ‘Overview’ trailer, ‘Global Jam’ demo set for August 9 to 10
item.content:encoded:
• Switch 2

Get a sneak peek of the game prior to launch.

Nintendo has released a seven-minute overview trailer for three-on-three wheelchair basketball Drag x Drive, as well as detailed a “Global Jam” demo event occurring from August 9 to 10.

Here are the details:

It’s a whole new ballgame when the Drag x Drive game unveils a new kind of three-on-three competitive sports experience utilizing the mouse and motion controls of both Joy-Con 2 controllers. Inspired by a mix of wheelchair basketball, wheelchair rugby, wheelchair motocross, and skateboarding, Drag x Drive lets you shoot, pass, dunk and perform tricks.

Use dual mouse controls to move your wheels by sliding both Joy-Con 2 controllers on a flat surface forward to move ahead or move just one controller to quickly turn and pivot and the other back. Once you grab the ball, simply raise your hand and flick your wrist to shoot. Rack up extra points by performing tricks like doing bunny hops, backflips, and even launching yourself off a half-pipe. You can also clap, wave and high-five your teammates using motion controls1!

And that’s just the beginning:

  • Hop into online lobbies for matches with players from near and far. Once 6 players join, a game will automatically start! Up to 12 people can join a Public Park.
  • You can also get a group of friends together (with or without GameChat3) to play in Friend Parks, which are private parks where you can pick and choose what you’d like to do. Make use of two courts for games and play matches with up to 6 players in one court. You can also compete against each other in additional challenges to try and earn the top spot on your park’s leaderboard!
  • Offline, you can also play alone against computer-controlled opponents to hone your skills.
  • Choose from a selection of three different drivers to suit your preferred play style: Guard, Center or Forward. Each driver has their own stats, so be sure to find the one that complements your game.
  • Looking for a change of pace? Hop off the court and race around a track in the Circuit Sprint minigame, compete in shooting contests or Park-wide minigames like Rebound Scramble, jump rope to practice bunny hopping and more.
  • Complete challenges to earn in-game trophies and unlock customizable helmets, which you can use to personalize your driver’s appearance. Match them up with your choice of armor, frames and tires, customize colors and add your preferred number to complete your look!

Can’t wait to get in the game? Nintendo is hosting a Drag x Drive: Global Jam demo event on August 9 and 10. Nintendo Switch 2 players with Nintendo Switch Online memberships can get a sneak peek of the game at select times prior to launch. For the full schedule and more details, visit here.

The Drag x Drive: Global Jam will run at the times listed below. Download the demo and shoot hoops with your friends during these times!

  • August 9, from 3:00 a.m. PT to 7:00 a.m. PT
  • August 9, from 5:00 p.m. PT to 9:00 p.m. PT
  • August 10, from 9:00 a.m. PT to 1:00 p.m. PT

Drag x Drive is due out for Switch 2 on August 14.

item.title: Hotel Barcelona launches September 26
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Physical editions distributed by Nighthawk Interactive.

Hotel Barcelona will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on September 26, publisher CULT Games and developer White Owls announced. A physical edition distributed by Nighthawk Interactive will also be available for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series, and is available for pre-order now at major retailers such as Amazon, Best Buy, GameStop, and more for $29.99.

Here is an overview of the game, via Nighthawk Interactive:

About

A deranged blend of horror, action, and grindhouse aesthetics, Hotel Barcelona invites players into a luxury hotel-turned-slaughterhouse where America’s most depraved serial killers await. When rookie U.S. Marshal Justine crashes near the hotel grounds, she’s pulled into a terrifying reality—and forced to unleash the monster lurking inside her mind: Dr. Carnival.

Developed by White Owls and published by Cult Games, this 2.5D side-scrolling action experience blends stylish slasher combat with over-the-top boss encounters, dripping atmosphere, and cooperative mayhem.

Key Features

  • A Floor for Every Fear – Fight your way through horror-themed hotel floors crawling with serial killers, each inspired by VHS-era horror icons. Expect jump scares, surreal twists, and buckets of blood.
  • A Killer Split Personality – Justine’s mind isn’t her own. Dr. Carnival, the ancient entity inside her, grants devastating powers—if you’re willing to pay the price.
  • Death is Only the Beginning – When you die, your past self becomes a shadowy ally. Each run builds strength and unleashes ghostly vengeance in this twisted take on rogue-lite mechanics.
  • Cooperative Carnage – Bring backup. Up to four players can check in together for bloody online multiplayer action.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure for PS5 launches August 5
item.content:encoded:
• PS5

Physical edition due out on August 29.

The PlayStation 5 version of open-world adventure game Hello Kitty Island Adventure will launch on August 5, developer Sunblink announced.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure first launched for Apple Arcade on July 28, 2023, followed by Switch and PC via Steam on January 30, 2025. Physical editions are due out for PlayStation 5 and Switch on August 29. A PlayStation 4 release is also planned, but has yet to be dated.

Here is an overview of the game, via Sunblink:

About

When My Melody is invited to open a gift shop at Big Adventures Park, she invites Hello Kitty and friends—including you! to come along for a tropical island adventure. But things go sideways upon arrival, with the friends separated and the park found abandoned. Join forces with Hello Kitty to restore the desolate theme park to its former glory and create the ultimate island paradise!

Create a unique, Sanrio-style original avatar and get to know iconic Sanrio characters like Kuromi, Badtz-Maru, Cinnamoroll, Chococat, and Aggretsuko. Share gifts, complete quests, and take part in island activities to deepen your bonds. Spruce up cabins to attract new visitors from among Hello Kitty’s many friends. Create a stylish wardrobe all your own, solve mysterious puzzles, cook delectable recipes, collect friendly critters, and fish, and explore the island solo or with a friend to unearth the many secrets of a massive in-game world.

Open-World Adventure

Welcome to Big Adventures Park, where friendships are key and adventure is just around the corner! Join your supercute new friends in a gorgeous world teeming with adorable creatures, delicious food, and many mysteries to explore.

Hello Kitty and Friends

Get to know supercute and friendly faces like Hello Kitty, Kuromi, Cinnamoroll, and more by discovering their likes, questing alongside them, and eventually becoming best friends. Craft rare items, solve ancient puzzles, and decorate cabins to bring new visitors and create your ultimate island paradise.

Key Features

  • Discover eight unique regions, from the ocean’s depths to an island in the clouds.
  • Befriend iconic characters like cheerful Hello Kitty, mischievous Kuromi, and sweet Cinnamoroll.
  • Bake, cook, and craft the perfect gifts to become best friends.
  • Renovate cabins and decorate them to attract even more wonderful characters.
  • Create your perfect avatar, find and customize hundreds of outfits tailored to you, and create and collect furniture to achieve your dream home aesthetic.
  • Celebrate the joys of summertime, the winter holidays, and more with a year round calendar of events. And don’t forget to throw birthday parties for your friends.
  • Solve hidden puzzles, catch cute critters, and garden to fill the world with flowers.
  • Dive into a multiplayer game with real-world friends and family: team up to explore, get bonuses, and take sweet snapshots together.
